meanings.definition: To move or transfer from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The worker was translocating boxes from the warehouse to the truck.
meanings.sent2: She translocates her belongings to her new apartment every year.
meanings.sent3: The cat was translocating its toys around the house, creating a playful mess.
meanings.sent4: The idea translocates from one mind to another, sparking creativity.
meanings.sent5: The river translocates sediment downstream, shaping the landscape over time.

meanings.definition: The act of moving or transferring from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: Translocating can be tiring but necessary when relocating.
meanings.sent2: The translocating of goods between countries is a complex process.
meanings.sent3: The translocating of students during a fire drill can be chaotic yet organized.
meanings.sent4: The translocating of energy from one form to another powers our daily lives.
meanings.sent5: The translocating of animals to new habitats helps preserve endangered species.
